cards.name: Bellsprout
cards.text: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Weepinbell

abilities.name: Dangerous Mucus
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned and Poisoned.

cards.text: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.

cards.name: Victreebel
cards.text: Once ingested into this Pokémon's body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.

attacks.name: Panic Vine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Cacnea
cards.text: It prefers harsh environments such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.

cards.name: Cacturne
cards.text: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.

attacks.name: Pull
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiny Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Kricketune V

abilities.name: Exciting Stage
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand. If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand instead. You can't use more than 1 Exciting Stage Ability each turn.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Cherubi
cards.text: The deeper a Cherubi's red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!

cards.name: Cherrim

abilities.name: Spring Bloom
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes).

cards.text: The faint scent that emanates from its full blossom entices bug Pokémon to it.

cards.name: Carnivine
cards.text: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Triple Whip
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Durant
cards.text: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

attacks.name: Devour
attacks.text: For each of your Durant in play, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Scatterbug
cards.text: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Spewpa
cards.text: The beaks of birds can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

attacks.name: Grass Cocooning
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Vivillon
cards.text: The patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

attacks.name: Vital Powder
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Fomantis
cards.text: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.

attacks.name: Continuous Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Lurantis
cards.text: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it's dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Tapu Bulu
cards.text: Although it's called a guardian deity, it's violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nature's Judgment
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Blipbug
cards.text: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

cards.name: Flapple V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sour Spit
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorless more.

cards.name: Flapple VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Rolling
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Entei
cards.text: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

attacks.name: Heat Dash
attacks.text: You may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Victini V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: V Bullet
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Flare Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Victini VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spreading Flames
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Max Victory
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Tepig
cards.text: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

cards.name: Pignite
cards.text: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

cards.name: Emboar

abilities.name: Fighting Fury Stance
abilities.text: Your Single Strike Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

cards.name: Heatmor
cards.text: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

attacks.name: Burning Licks
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Salandit
cards.text: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.

attacks.name: Call Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Salazzle
cards.text: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Derisive Roasting
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Sizzlipede
cards.text: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they're well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Centiskorch

abilities.name: Overheater
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent flips a coin for their Burned Pokémon during Pokémon Checkup, it doesn't recover from that Special Condition even if the result is heads.

cards.text: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

attacks.name: Bursting Inferno
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Horsea
cards.text: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

cards.name: Seadra
cards.text: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.

cards.name: Kingdra

abilities.name: Deep Sea King
abilities.text: When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, you may move any amount of Water Energy from that Pokémon to this Pokémon.

cards.text: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life forms can survive.

attacks.name: Aqua Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Galarian Mr. Mime
cards.text: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. It'll spend the whole day tap-dancing on a frozen floor.

attacks.name: Find It
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Galarian Mr. Rime
cards.text: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.

attacks.name: Ball Juggling
attacks.text: Discard any number of Item cards that have the word "Ball" in their name from your hand. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Remoraid
cards.text: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine's underside to scavenge for leftovers.

cards.name: Octillery

abilities.name: Rapid Strike Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Rapid Strike card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Rapid Strike Search Ability each turn.

cards.text: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

cards.name: Corphish
cards.text: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Crawdaunt
cards.text: A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Empoleon V

abilities.name: Emperor's Eyes
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Basic Pokémon in play have no Abilities, except for Pokémon with a Rule Box (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes).

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swirling Slice
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Frillish
cards.text: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon and heal all damage from it.

cards.name: Jellicent
cards.text: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.

attacks.name: Sediment Sink
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each Water Energy card in your discard pile.

cards.name: Bruxish
cards.text: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie's spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: While it's often blamed for power outages, the truth is the cause of outages is more often an error on the part of the electric company.

attacks.name: Haymaker
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Haymaker.

cards.name: Electivire
cards.text: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Lightning Slam
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Lightning Slam.

cards.name: Shinx
cards.text: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

cards.name: Luxio
cards.text: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

attacks.name: Jumping Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Luxray
cards.text: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Electrostep
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scar Strikes
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Pachirisu
cards.text: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Tapu Koko V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spiral Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Tapu Koko VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Shock
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, their Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Yamper

abilities.name: Ball Search
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Poké Ball card, a Great Ball card, or 1 of each from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.text: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

cards.name: Boltund
cards.text: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Defiant Spark
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack can be used for Lightning.

cards.name: Galarian Slowpoke
cards.text: Because Galarian Slowpoke eat the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor.

attacks.name: Tantailizing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Spoink
cards.text: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.

cards.name: Grumpig
cards.text: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Baltoy
cards.text: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

cards.name: Claydol
cards.text: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.

attacks.name: Power Split
attacks.text: Attach Psychic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like until your Pokémon and your opponent's Pokémon have the same total amount of Energy attached.

cards.name: Chimecho
cards.text: Emitting ultrasonic cries, it floats on winds to travel great distances.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Pleasant Tone
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Espurr
cards.text: There's enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can't be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Meowstic

abilities.name: Ear Moves
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It's when they're protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.

cards.name: Mimikyu V

abilities.name: Dummy Doll
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may prevent all damage done to this Mimikyu V by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon until the end of your opponent's next turn.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Jealous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Necrozma V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Prismatic Ray
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Special Laser
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Dottler
cards.text: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

attacks.name: Radar
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

cards.name: Orbeetle
cards.text: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what's around it—and what's around it can include things over six miles away.

attacks.name: Evomancy
attacks.text: For each Energy attached to this Pokémon, search your deck for a Stage 2 Pokémon, except Orbeetle, and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Mankey
cards.text: If one gets angry, all the others around it will get angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop of Mankey.

attacks.name: Focus Fist
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Primeape
cards.text: The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than those of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy despite its constant raging.

attacks.name: Field Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Steamin' Mad Strike
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Onix
cards.text: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

attacks.name: Rocky Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

cards.name: Cubone
cards.text: It wears its mother's skull on its head, so no one knows what its bare face looks like. However, it's clear that it's always crying.

cards.name: Marowak

abilities.name: Battle Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: They thump their bones rhythmically to communicate among themselves. There are nearly 50 different rhythmic patterns.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Gligar
cards.text: It flies straight at its target's face then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

cards.name: Gliscor
cards.text: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey… Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Timburr
cards.text: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.

cards.name: Gurdurr
cards.text: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there's skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.

cards.name: Conkeldurr
cards.text: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.

attacks.name: Hammer Pressure
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Mienfoo
cards.text: They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Mienshao
cards.text: When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, you're in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!

attacks.name: Spinning Whip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. Shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

cards.name: Rolycoly
cards.text: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Carkol
cards.text: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Coalossal
cards.text: While it's engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.

attacks.name: Coal Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Silicobra
cards.text: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

cards.name: Sandaconda
cards.text: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.

attacks.name: Big Sand Cannon
attacks.text: Discard the top 6 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each Fighting Energy card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Falinks
cards.text: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

attacks.name: Rapid Strike Squad
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Rapid Strike Pokémon in play.

cards.name: Stonjourner
cards.text: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.

attacks.name: Land's Pulse
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Giga Hammer
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer.

cards.name: Single Strike Urshifu V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Laser Focus
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fighting Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Impact Blow
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Impact Blow.

cards.name: Single Strike Urshifu VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max One Blow
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Rapid Strike Urshifu V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Rapid Strike Urshifu VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gale Thrust
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: G-Max Rapid Flow
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zubat
cards.text: Their skin is so thin that they'll be burned if sunlight hits them. When it gets cold out, they gather together to warm one another's bodies.

attacks.name: Hide in Shadows
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Golbat

abilities.name: Discreet Draw
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

cards.text: They can suck down over 10 ounces of blood in one go. They have been known to drink so much blood that they can no longer fly.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Crobat

abilities.name: Drastic Draw
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.

cards.text: It feeds on the blood of living people and Pokémon. If it can't drink any blood for even a short while, it becomes weak and unable to fly.

cards.name: Galarian Slowbro
cards.text: If this Pokémon squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.

attacks.name: Splattering Poison
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Unhinged Hammer
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Murkrow
cards.text: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow's presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

cards.name: Honchkrow

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Asleep.

cards.text: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.

attacks.name: Voltage Dive
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Houndour
cards.text: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.

cards.name: Houndoom

abilities.name: Single Strike Roar
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Single Strike Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Single Strike Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.text: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.

cards.name: Tyranitar V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cragalanche
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Single Strike Crush
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Morpeko
cards.text: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

attacks.name: Gather Food
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hangry Tackle
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Steelix
cards.text: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

attacks.name: Steel Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Mawile
cards.text: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

attacks.name: Powerful Vise
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Piercing Strike
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Bronzor
cards.text: Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface reflect the truth, according to common lore. Be that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.

cards.name: Bronzong

abilities.name: Metal Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move a Metal Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: Many scientists suspect that this Pokémon originated outside the Galar region, based on the patterns on its body.

cards.name: Pawniard
cards.text: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Slash attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Bisharp
cards.text: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.

attacks.name: Steel Slice
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Metal Pokémon, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Honedge
cards.text: The blue eye on the sword's handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people's lives away.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Doublade
cards.text: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Stance Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch this Pokémon with an Aegislash in your hand. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.

cards.text: Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash reigned over the land. His Pokémon eventually drained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.

attacks.name: Full Metal Blade
attacks.text: Discard 2 Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Stance Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch this Pokémon with an Aegislash in your hand. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.

cards.text: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.

attacks.name: Gigaton Bash
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon VMAX.

cards.name: Corviknight V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Sky Hurricane
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Sky Hurricane.

cards.name: Corviknight VMAX

abilities.name: Lustrous Body
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Hurricane
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use G-Max Hurricane.

cards.name: Spearow
cards.text: Due to its short wings, it can't fly long distances. It wanders about restlessly and pecks at bug Pokémon.

cards.name: Fearow
cards.text: Carrying food through Fearow's territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: It licks filth clean with its tongue. Whatever it licks always stinks afterward, so whether it's really clean is…questionable.

cards.name: Lickilicky
cards.text: It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a single small bean with its tongue.

attacks.name: Selickt
attacks.text: Your opponent chooses to discard the top 3 cards of their deck or to discard 3 cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Pitch
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Glameow
cards.text: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

cards.name: Purugly
cards.text: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Stoutland V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Double Dip Fangs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Basic Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Sap Sipper
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Grass Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Drampa
cards.text: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it's angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Spiral Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Indeedee
cards.text: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Hand Kinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Bruno
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw 7 cards instead.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Camping Gear
cards.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. Your turn ends.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Cheryl
cards.text: Heal all damage from each of your Evolution Pokémon. If you do, discard all Energy from the Pokémon that were healed in this way.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Energy Recycler
cards.text: Shuffle up to 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Escape Rope
cards.text: Each player switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon. Your opponent switches first. (If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, they don't switch Pokémon.),You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Exp. Share
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, you may move a Basic Energy from that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Fan of Waves
cards.text: Put a Special Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon on the bottom of their deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Korrina's Focus
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Level Ball
cards.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon with 90 HP or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Phoebe
cards.text: During this turn, damage from your Pokémon VMAX's attacks isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Rapid Strike Scroll of Swirls
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,The Rapid Strike Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.),You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

attacks.name: Matchless Maelstrom
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Rapid Strike Style Mustard
cards.text: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.,Put a Rapid Strike Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. If you do, draw 5 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Single Strike Scroll of Scorn
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,The Single Strike Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.),You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

attacks.name: Furious Anger
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Single Strike Style Mustard
cards.text: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.,Search your deck for a Single Strike Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, draw 5 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Sordward & Shielbert
cards.text: Choose a Trainer card from your discard pile. Then, ask your opponent if you may put it into your hand. If yes, put that card into your hand. If no, draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Tool Jammer
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,As long as the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot, Pokémon Tools attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon have no effect, except for Tool Jammer.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Tower of Darkness
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may draw 2 cards. In order to use this effect, that player must discard a Single Strike card from their hand.,This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Tower of Waters
cards.text: The Retreat Cost of each Rapid Strike Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) is ColorlessColorless less.,This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Urn of Vitality
cards.text: Shuffle up to 2 Single Strike Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Rapid Strike Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to a Rapid Strike Pokémon. If this card is attached to anything other than a Rapid Strike Pokémon, discard this card.,As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides 2 in any combination of Water Energy and Fighting Energy.

cards.name: Single Strike Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to a Single Strike Pokémon. If this card is attached to anything other than a Single Strike Pokémon, discard this card.,As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Fighting and Darkness Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time, and the attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Kricketune V

abilities.name: Exciting Stage
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand. If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand instead. You can't use more than 1 Exciting Stage Ability each turn.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorless more.

attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 50 more damage.

abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Basic Pokémon in play have no Abilities, except for Pokémon with a Rule Box (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes).

cards.text: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

cards.text: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.
